Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBaderFan
Reviews.Content: I could not find any other hotel in town that had an opening so this was my only choice. The bed was comfortable and room was clean. People were friendly at the front desk and Breakfest in the morning was fine. It was also very quite in the hall. The room could use an upgrade. It looked old an out of date. Tv was really old. Now saying this I would stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DAREINA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at a perfect location to shopping and resturants. Rooms are clean with towels available at the pool.Check-in & check-out went smoothly. Breakfast at hotel was pretty good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: OakParkBob1026
Reviews.Content: My son and I are on a tour of midwest colleges and universities. Our stop here will surely be one of the highlights. Penny at the front desk was extremely nice, and we were pleasantly surprised at how clean and spacious our room turned out to be. Nice pool, extensive room service menu, and fresh hot waffles in the AM. What more could we ask for? This place is terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buzybee150
Reviews.Content: Rooms are always clean and the beds aren't too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience! Terrible service! Avoid this property!”
Reviews.Author: 30043ron
Reviews.Content: Because of this property's good Trip Advisor reviews, we booked a room through Hotels.com for December 27-30. Day one was uneventful, although I agree with a previous reviewer that this property could use an upgrade. Nothing special. Surprising, in fact, due to the good Trip Advisor reviews. At about 11:30 p.m. the second night, we were abruptly awakened by a screaming fire alarm. Somehow the ceiling fire sprinkler went off in a guest room two doors down from our room and across the hall. Water came streaming out of the room and before long, two fire department trucks arrived. By the time the water was cut off, it had streamed down the hall to our room's door. We hurriedly packed the van, sloshed down the hall to check out, and met "George" behind the counter. I asked for a refund for the two remaining nights and for check-out documentation. He asked if would like to be moved to a room on the second floor. When I declined, he replied that I would have to contact Hotels.com for a refund, and further, they didn't give check out documentation in this case. After I got home, I called Hotel's.com and have received no satisfactory service from them or Country Inn and Suites Champaign-North. I called Hotels.com and when they failed to work out a compromise, I called "Penny" the manager of the property. So I ask you? You are aakened by a fire alarm, two fire trucks, and ambulance, workmen trying to stop water from flooding your room, the smell stinks and I should not be able to check out early for a refund? (By the way, my reservation was not an advance, no changes reservation!) Some service! For those interested, Wingate, right next door, was so much nicer in facilities and staff for the same price. Unfortunately, unless I can win an appeal with my Discover Card, I guess consumer satisfaction is not the paradigm with either Country Inns and Suites or Hotels.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay & service”
Reviews.Author: Dick K
Reviews.Content: We wish to express our gratitude to Bryan, the manager over Christmas weekend, for the outstanding service we received. The hotel was quiet, clean, and the entire staff was very responsive. Food (breakfast) was very good and the serving staff kept things clean and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: gosox35805
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, but it could use an upgrade.We had a one bedroom suite.Suite size was okay, would be nice to have a better TV. Breakfast buffet was not impressive.Food did not taste good and very limited in what they had to offer as part of the buffet. The lady that checked us in was nice, but the lady that worked overnight seemed to be having a bad night,not very friendly. Pool is nice with plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience in Champaign”
Reviews.Author: lizzybaby230
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Champaign, neither of us having been there before. We were very pleased when we were offered to upgrade to a room with a jacuzzi for no extra charge. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, offering directions to local restaurants etc. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rickey-n-gina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for three days and very much enjoyed our stay. The lobby, halls and room were all VERY CLEAN, and did not have any "cleaning" oder. Our room was very nice, like a small studio apartment. The hall noise is the only complaint we would have, as on the weekend you could hear it in the front part of the room. The noise was not noticeable in our "bedroom" area. There was a small fridge, small microwave, couch, chair, office chair and table with tv in the front living area. There was a small open sink and the bathroom in the middle area/hall. The bedroom area was seperated by a french style door and provide a very nice home style feeling. We were very happy with the stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice rooms; excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: jtoothman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and the room and service were exceptional. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but there are better choices”
Reviews.Author: clvier1
Reviews.Content: Checked in pretty late at night...no problem there. Lobby area smallish but pleasant. I was staying with partial points and there was no issue there. The room I was in was actually like a small suite, separate couch and wingback chair with tv, and a little kitchen area with microwave and fridge. The bathroom was a bit spartan in decor, as was the rest of the room. We wanted the fan on for some white noise at night, but the hvac was very noisy. Bed was comfortable with a major pillowtop mattress. Breakfast in the am (we slept in after the trip and a busy evening and workweek) was just okay, french toast was very hard and eggs hard as well - tasted like it had been out a while. That said, the breakfast spread did have good variety. Not a fan of those vitality juices so many hotels have now...they always seem very sweet. I would recommend the Wyndham next door instead - newer, nicer, and more thoughtfully designed.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hands down some of the worst service I have experienced from a hotel and I am a meeting planner / hotel buyer for a large corporation who has a fair look at the industry and hotels in this area. The General Manager wont respond to calls and Brian at the first desk was rude. Stay away from this property.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect...”
Reviews.Author: Time4Scuba
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. If you are familiar with the Country Inn & Suites properties you will find that the look and feel of this hotel is a cookie cutter of all the rest. I personally like the familiarity of the Country Inn & Suites, I don't worry about what I'm going to walk into on arrival. We had a late check in and apparently they had some computer problems so the desk clerk wasn't able to check to see if they had an upgrade for us, but it really wasn't a big deal as we just needed a place to sleep, shower & eat as we passed through this area. Breakfast area was HUGE with a big screen TV that matched the area. If you have a large group traveling this is the place to stay just for the huge breakfast area. I've been at some C.I. & S that there were only a few tables and I had to take my breakfast back to my room- not the case here. My only complaint would be that housekeeping knocked on our door at 9AM (not happy since we didn't check in until 1AM) - we didn't have the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door, but we had a one night stay and check out wasn't until noon, why the rush? Lesson learned at this hotel - be sure to use the door signs! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently clean and excellent upgrades”
Reviews.Author: iaillini
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Champaign to attend University of Illinois Homecoming games for 34 years now, and since switching to this hotel in the past 10 years, have never been disappointed. Every service person and front desk staff member always offers a friendly smile and a "hello" when you see them. Their rooms are always clean and well maintained, which is something to be said in a University town where hotel rooms are typically beat up and old before their time. The pool area is also kept spotlessly clean, as is their dining area. One of the best additions has to be the use of real silverware, coffee mugs and dinner plates for their breakfast. There is just something about eating your cereal out of a real bowl instead of a cheap paper one that is satisfying! We will continue to return to the Country Inn and Suites for our Homecoming stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ThePatrick4
Reviews.Content: My wife nad I stayed at this hotel on 9/17/11. This was our first time staying at this chain. Our room was a 2 room suite and was furnished nicely with added extra's, such as 2 tv's, couch, microwave and fridge. The hotel had a Business center with free use of computers and printers, for checking e-mails and printing boarding passes, which was very convenient.They offered a full hot breakfast with many varieties of food and drinks. The best experience was the staff, who were very profesional, courteous and helpful. They arranged on a short notice to shuttle us to the train station downtown since we had no transportation and was relying on public transportation. Overall a very pleasant experience and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best pool & breakfast buffet ever!”
Reviews.Author: FarmRescueVolunteer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several different hotels in Champaign, IL, and will now make this Country Inn our first choice. If you have children or if you yourself like to swim, you'll love this pool. The water was warm and comfortable. In fact, so many people were enjoying the pool during our Friday night stay that they ran out of pool towels. The staff was quite accommodating, however, and gave us extra regular bath towels to use instead. Some reviews had mentioned the noisy ac. For us it was just right - enough noise to give us "white noise" in order to sleep and an ac which stayed on all night instead of going on and off. Speaking of noise, we were right across from the busy pool, but once we closed our door, we never heard a sound. Must have great noise-reduction insulation in the walls. As if all these thing were not great enough, breakfast this morning impressed me the most. Rarely does one get to eat breakfast at a hotel on real, solid dishes with real, heavy silverware. What a treat! By the way, they also have a later checkout time than most hotels: officially 12 noon, but 1pm was fine we were told. My only "complaint" was seeing cobwebs where the ceiling and walls met. I mentioned it to the mgr on duty this morning and expect that we won't see that again during our next stay! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and we would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DBIOWA
Reviews.Content: My husband and & stayed at this hotel on Aug 12, 2011 and were impressed. We have stayed at Country Inn & Suites previously and have always been completely satisfied, but this had even more features. We had a very clean room, comfortable bed, and the room was nicely furnished. The staff was very professional, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast had a great variety of food, tasted good, and the lunch room was kept very clean. The nice surprise was eating from glass plates, cups, glasses and silverware. Also, we appreciate being able to apply some of our points earned from previous stays to lower the price of the room. With most hotel chains, by the time you have built up enough points, they expire and there are no benefits. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familyof597
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. This was our third stay at this location. We had found a great rate on their site. The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. The kids really enjoyed the warm pool. The breakfast buffet was great with plenty of hot and fresh food. The breakfast attendants were very friendly. The only downside of the visit was the air conditioning unit in our room was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Pb1115pb
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and bed was comfortable. When air conditioner came on it sounded like a 747. TV's were old and only basic cable was offered.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL service with attitude”
Reviews.Author: freelibran
Reviews.Content: NEVER again. Was given the wrong room and then relocated to a room with a broken thermostat. Only one person on staff who was so disrespectful and said she couldn't give us the right room "because now we have to clean the one you're in." Excuse me? As we waited hours to resolve this, we were forced to sit in a room that was 85 degrees with a TV that was probably from 1970. Oh yes - the pool and spa had probably 100 children playing in it with no supervision. Don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: “Rude service from Brian”
Reviews.Author: megam0m
Reviews.Content: I have traveled in many countries and never received such a rude reception as I did from Brian at the check-in desk. He was incredibly rude, continually interrupted and talked over me and wouldn't help me with what was a very simple problem. With so many hotels to choose from Champaign, you would think that the people who work would try to be a little bit helpful, or at least not be exceptionally rude!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelnews4U
Reviews.Content: The Country Inn and Suites Hotels provide comfortable no-frills accommodations for travelers on a budget. My one night stay was pleasant. I had a king whirlpool room. Though the decor was dated (but definitely country) it was clean and comfortable. The whirlpool jets were weak, but the tub is deep and extra towels were provided. My room also had a small frig and microwave. Wireless internet worked great! Breakfast was just OK as they had run out of cereals and the waffle maker was not working. I had the basic toast, eggs, and fruit selections. Coffee was decent. The location of this hotel is convenient to I-74, shopping, and restaurants. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly Clean, Comfortable Room, Great Breakfast, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: mn_travelers02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews - and we weren't disappointed. The desk clerk was very friendly and helpful - even had a sense of humor after a long work day. He suggested a good restaurant nearby as we arrived too late for the complimentary wine and snack. The room was attractive, the bed was very comfortable, and it was nice to have a fridge in the room to store food from our cooler. But the best part of the stay was breakfast - it's rare to find a good selection of fresh fruit in any restaurant, let alone a "breakfast included" place, along with a variety of standard breakfast foods. I thought I'd died and gone to heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! FANTASTIC breakfast & great service at breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: XJ650Rocks!
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Saturday night in order to see a play at the college. Checked in with Penny who was pleasant. Rooms clean, neat. Nice to have microwave and fridge. Cute little hotel. I was absolutely BLOWN AWAY with the breakfast on Sunday morning. Not only were there items to choose from other then carbs, carbs and more carbs.....everything was spotless, neatly arranged & CLEAN. Love that some hotels offer breakfast, but always disappointed when the menu doesn't include any protein. Candace, the young woman in charge of the breakfast area, was amazing. Friendly, quick, kept everything well stocked and very clean. That was so nice. Thanks again! Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: mpsena
Reviews.Content: I was in town to look at the university. The hotel's location was great -- very close to a really good pizza place -- the room was clean and very comfortable, and the staff was very cordial. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MMJ01
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a one bedroom suite - very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast selection was pretty good. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ask questions”
Reviews.Author: t16mytm
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have never stay in your hotel before but I wanted to ask some questions before making a decision. I have been sending emails to your hotels for the past 1 week and had not receive any answers from you all thats why I resolve to this method to contact your hotel. I have seen comments with regards to your hotel and wants to make some clearification. 1) I read that you have shuttle service to UIUC is that true? 2) I am coming from Chicago 'O Hara airport, taking the Lincoln express, I would like to know where to drop off 3) I would like to know if I book your hotels in muti states, is there any discount? Hope to hear from you all soon Thanks My email is : t16mytm@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “The Country Inn in Champaign is an outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dianeballowe
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Country Inn. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The facilities were clean and inviting. I particularly appreciated Dawn in the breakfast room, who kept the food well-stocked and the room spotless. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, service-oriented. Will make this a regular stop in C-U.”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhead52
Reviews.Content: Having a son at the U of I we get down to Champaign fairly often. This place has made us feel like regulars, from Kacee at the front desk to Steve the building guy. Biggest problem is the LOUD AC in the locked closet, and the alarm that went off in the closet at 7 am. The other gripe is the TV reception--the signal lost color for most of our recent stay (plus, I'm beginning to expect to have LCD TV's in my room when I travel, which this hotel does not). Our service experience, especially with Kacee, trumps these problems, however, and we look forward to future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel, No Maintance”
Reviews.Author: v213809
Reviews.Content: nothing good about this hotel .worst country inn and suites i have ever stayed at .first room smells bad like smoke,computer chair is broken,go to the bath room in a strobe light ,bathroom light keeps flashing off and on , then we go down to the pool and the hottub is cold and only 1 or 2 jets work and the swimmong pool is colder

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VaibhavGupta
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever Business trip. I stayed at County Inn and Suites. Hotel was booked by my company. I admire the Hotel building. Location is nice and peacesful. I had great shopping experience as everything was so nearby - Best Buy, Circuit City, Meijer, Wall Mart, Market place, Kohl's. Hotel was nice. Breakfast was superb. Little noisy on weekends but then I did not stay much in Hotel on weekends. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Wolud love to get another Business trip and a stay to Country Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quality hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: epsharon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay during the last weekend of February. It was a good location just off of I-74 but far enough away that you couldn't hear the traffic. Check-in was quick and efficient and we helped ourself to a cookie from the plate in the lobby. Our room was quite big and the beds were comfortable. Even the pillows were nice quality. The room was clean and the shower head had good pressure. These are the things that will make us come back. The indoor pool, fitness center and included breakfast are nice pluses. The only things we were disappointed in was the fact that the hot tub was out of order the night we stayed, there were lots of kids running through the halls at 10pm and then again at 11pm, there was no one manning the front desk when we checked out at 10:30am so we had to wait aournd for 5 minutes and our main complaint: the breakfast didn't have fried or scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage or hash browns. I would think most people would expect an included hot breakfast to have these things. At the very least you should have a type of egg available (sorry, hard boiled doesn't count) and either bacon, sausage or a potato. The morning we ate, there were pancakes and waffles, why both as they are essentially the same thing and the pancake spot in the warmer could have had eggs instead. All in all, this is a very good hotel for Champaign and one we would stay in again. If it weren't for the few things we were disappointed in, it would have received an "Excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel out of 5 trips to area!”
Reviews.Author: anyaMunster
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a week stay, where I found this hotel to be very charming. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were spacious and clean. To sum it up I have listed the pros and cons. Pros: very clean, nice decor with a lounge and fireplace complete with large flat-screen on the wall. Besides the plate of free cookies, perhaps the best feature was how quiet it was during my stay. No running down the halls, slamming doors and talking I found to be bothersome at other hotels closer to the university. Free WI-FI in the rooms. Feather pillows (nice touch). Cons: TV is a bit dated in the room and there is not a large variety of channels. Closet was a bit small (but I made do). The small refrigerator and microwave sat on the floor. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay. I was looking for a quiet relaxing hotel far enough away from the "college scene" to get a good night sleep and I found it here. If I travel to the area again, I will definitely be returning. By the way, the hotel is less than 10 min to the UoI.

Reviews.Title: “Diligent Service, Delicious Food, Dirty Hair”
Reviews.Author: Hpmicks
Reviews.Content: My 17 year old son and I recently stay at the Country Inn and Suites in Champaign on a college visit to the University of Illinois. The hotel is fairly convenient to campus and the admissions office was easy to find. We arrived around midnight and were happy to find attentive staff and fresh cookies in the cookie jar. Check in was a breeze, there was plenty of parking for the car and the room was easy to find. The lights, TV, and heat/air-conditioning all worked and the beds were super comfortable. Our only problem was that housekeeping had failed to replace the shampoo that my son was depending on for his morning shower. The complimentary breakfast was excellent and included eggs, sausage, waffles and the usual pastries, bagels and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful: Clean rooms, comfy beds, courteous staff, fresh waffles for breakfast= happy stay”
Reviews.Author: CheriD
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Our family of six (4 adults, 1 teen) stayed in two rooms for two nights. Our rooms were clean with oh-so comfortable, comforter-topped beds and well-equipped with microwave, tiny frig, and coffeemaker. The staff was friendly and helpful. The free continental breakfast offered the regular fare, plus hot waffles, french toast, and biscuits and gravy. Guests make their own waffles with an easy to work machine, but whenever anyone had trouble with it, the lady in charge was quick to offer to make one for them. Books to borrow in the breakfast room were a nice, homey touch as was the filled cookie jar on the check-in counter. The indoor pool area had a hot tub and convenient showers. Restrooms were nearby in the hall. There are a lot of hotels clustered together in this spot near a large mall and other shopping, but I can tell you that you will be well taken care of at this one. These people are really trying to make their guests feel at home and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Love everthing about this hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: wisconsingravylover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have enjoyed our past experiences at this hotel. Staff is courteous and helpful, rooms, halls, etc. are very clean and inviting, pool area is well kept, beda and pillows are among the most comfortable that we have experienced anywhere and we have found the free breakfast abounds with choices and was very good. However, we just returned from another stay, and have found some disappointing changes in the breakfast. Several items we had enjoyed in the past were missing and the gravy for the biscuits no longer has any pork sausage in it. It is now strictly a "pepper gravy"--very gooey and bland to say the least! Please return to the original menu which helped to make yours a truly outstanding free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: wizofwoz
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and beautifully decorated, beds were very comfortable, room was also very soundproof (we were located right next to a busy pool and never heard anything) and price was fair. BUT the front desk personnel were basically non-existent. When we checked in, there was no one there and no bell to ring. We waited a short time and someone showed up. A short time later, I went to the front desk and again no one was there. I waited several minutes, then went looking around for someone, ANYONE who could help me. I finally yelled "HELLO!" towards a open back door and the front desk lady apparently was right in the next room and I startled her. I don't expect the front desk people to just stand there waiting for a customer to show up but if they are in a back room, there needs to be a tv camera to alert them they have a customer or at the very least a bell to ring. A guest shouldn't have to stand there waiting for someone to happen upon them. Then the other gripe I have is their business center. Every hotel I've been to uses the room key to access a business center but the Country Inn and Suites chooses to make this difficult. You have to go to the front desk to get a special key and you must then return the key. This normally would not be such a big problem but then I refer back to the problem of no front desk people....you can't get a key or return a key if nobody is there. And the business center was FREEZING! The one lady who was in there trying to get some work done was wrapped in a blanket. I was just in there to print out boarding passes so just jogged in place to keep warm. But I will clarify that when the front desk people DID show up, they were very pleasant and friendly. One recommendation if you visit Champaign, print out or bring a very good map. I unfortunately booked the Country Inn and Suites thinking it was an airport hotel. Luckily I had a map because there are no signs to the airport and from the hotel it was a slow, stop and go ride and even with the map, I would doubt myself....you drive through the downtown and then find yourself on a dark road that looks like you're in the middle of nowhere and then all of a sudden you see a lighted airport sign....and that's it, you can't see the airport, just the sign. Maybe it's better in the daylight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Retired-having-fun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip North and enjoyed 1 night at this Country Inn & Suites, as we were passing through the area. Easy to find, near the highway but out of the highway noise. Neat clean hotel with large room, VERY comfortable beds, and nice buffet breakfast. Many restaurants right near by. Yes, we would return if ever in the area again. We always try to stay in a Comfort Inn & Suites if there is one in the area and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “My First Stay--I'd Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: PastorMom
Reviews.Content: Got this room through Prlceline and was pleased to find upon checking in that my rooms were suites rather than single rooms. I had booked two but was unable to get adjoining rooms. However, they ensured that my rooms were across the hall from each other. Breakfast was a bit lacking, and there wasn't enough room in the breakfast area for everyone, but we eventually ate and moved on. The rooms were nice enough, and I was pleased to have free wireless internet. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We had An Excellent Stay--Only a Couple areas Could use Slight Improvement”
Reviews.Author: kotzg
Reviews.Content: Excellent things about our stay: Room was great, noise was minimal to non-existent, our kids had a great time using the wonderful rocking chairs on the front "porch" outside the inn, we all enjoyed the pool, and the the generous, well-stocked, healthy and FREE buffet breakfast was excellent. The front desk and buffet staff were all very courteous, attentive, and helpful. Hotel pool and whirlpool were both great and very clean. Small areas for improvement: 1. Breakfast buffet: Could use a second 4-slice toaster and a second waffle iron, as it slowed our breakfast having to wait in line or watch for these items to free up (each guest toasts their own toast and also pours the available pitcher of pre-prepared waffle batter into the waffle iron to make their own waffles). The lobby and the "front porch" were both charming, and they welcome visitors to "sit for a spell"--very nice touches. 2. Both men's and women's first-floor bathrooms (near the pool), in the summer, were literally about 50 degrees or colder. My husband inquired at the front desk about the extreme chill, and hotel staff said there was no way to control the AC in there, it was all part of the AC for the entire hotel. A shame, really, because our small children couldn't even go in there and us it, it was so cold, and I got a bad chill changing in there with a swimsuit on you can imagine how cold that was.

Reviews.Title: “Of all the hotels in Champaign, I choose Country Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: Illinois09
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I am in Champaign frequently. I have stayed at other nice hotels but I always come back to this one. The entire staff is incredible! They will do their very best to make sure everything is just right. The rooms are very clean. Much of the hotel has undergone updates. The business center offers internet access as well as a printer. For my money, I think this hotel is the best!

Reviews.Title: “College town home-away-from-home”
Reviews.Author: vicChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a campus visit at the University of IL. Extremely pleasant and comfortable furnishings and Alana at the front desk was warm and welcoming. The lobby, hallways and room looked and smelled fresh and clean. There's a nice indoor pool that we did not use. Our room was a one-bedroom king suite, so the teenagers could watch tv in the living room and my husband and I could close the door and watch tv in the bedroom. The room included a microwave and small fridge. I thought the bed was really comfortable. The only down side was a heating vent in the corner of the room that was kind of loud when we turned up the heat. We requested additional towels and the front desk brought them up immediately. Room rate includes a wonderful hot breakfast in a very pleasant dining room: Fluffy scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, and a huge variety of cereals, waffles, yogurt, fruit, juices, biscuits and gravy, etc etc...There are a bunch of hotels in the area--easy to get to off the highway, and just minutes from campus. I didn't see a restaurant within walking distance, but we had pizza delivered to the room. Our son will be a freshman, and we plan on making this our home-away-from-home for the next 4 years--at least as often as he lets us visit!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: twilson3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Country Inn while I was going to see the Rascal Flatts Concert. The motel was clean and the staff was friendly. It was near many restaurants so we could get something to eat after the concert. I would choose this hotel if I am in Champaign again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been much better”
Reviews.Author: AriGold69
Reviews.Content: Parking lot was a sheet of ice upon arrival and departure. Our room was right across the hall from an ice machine which made an amazing amount of noise. The wireless signal was very spotty. The breakfast buffet had very few healthy items, including fruit. The jacuzzi and pool had way too much chlorine in it and were closed for maintenance on a Sunday morning!

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: rakawa
Reviews.Content: The location was good. It is near the mall, Meijers, a Starbucks with a dirve-thru, Wal-Mart, Target, and numerous restaurants. There never was that much traffic so driving to see relatives about 6 miles away in Urbana was not a big deal. We paid $169+ tax to get what was billed as a jacuzzi suite. We really only wanted to guarantee we would have a king bed. Strangely, the giant jacuzzi tub was literally in the sleeping area about 4 feet from the bed. Frankly, all of the prices at this hotel seemed steep for what it was. The room was OK, but we could never get the temperature right because of the old time a/c-heat unit. There were dark brown stains on box spring on both sides of the bed. On the second day of our stay they did not leave any shampoo, but rather two conditioners. A mistake anyone could make in a hurry, so no biggie there. The common areas are nice enough, but were constantly overrun with kids. The breakfast area was fine as were the pastries. Free breakast is a nice treat, but the selection was not that great. Pastries, waffles, and other sugary sweet things. The coffee was not hot which was disappointing, but there isa small coffee maker in the room. I would recommend this hotel for families with kids (if you can get a decent room rate) because of the following: pool; free breakfast; rooms have a small kitchenette area with fridge; and it is close to lots of shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Manteno
Reviews.Content: This was my first Courntry Inn and Suites stay. Have to say I was not impressed. In need of a good rehab. Carpet, bedding and towels very tired. Breakfast was decent. Had to laugh that someone else come back to a room with the doors wide open. I went and told them I forgot me key and went back and locked it up. It is crazy as I had not checked out. Never had that happen before. Several new hotels going up in the area. Many better options in town.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sleepy99
Reviews.Content: The motel is clean and modern. Very comfortable room. Fitness center, breakfast area and business room clean. quiet location. Very comfortable bed. A good night's sleep. The only problem we had that will keep me from going back to this hotel would be the manager's policy and rudeness. We stepped out for breakfast and when we came back the door was wide open and the room was being cleaned. Check out is 12:00 it was only 10:15. I did not check out but had brought most of our things to the car. We were returning to swim and shower after breakfast. The manager told me "too bad, you should know to leave all your things in there, so we checked you out ourselves." I have never heard of such a thing and will be contacting the chain to let them know this is her policy. No "sorry" or anything. I was out of luck and told to leave. Suggestion: If you step out of this hotel, let the desk know you do not want them in your room when you are gone.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: fluffystella2004
Reviews.Content: I just needed a nice, guest friendly hotel to stay at. This hotel was all of that. The bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom clean and the staff was pleasant. My one complaint would be that the walls were too thin and the guests' TV next door was pretty loud. There was breakfast but I slept in and didn't get a chance to try it out. The Country Inn & Suites was a good fit for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: momof2boys52
Reviews.Content: Our son is going to U of I so we have stayed at several other area hotels. This is one of our favorites. It is a little further from campus than some of the others but worth the extra few minutes. We have stayed here 3 times in the last year and have made reservations for two future visits. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff is very warm and helpful. They have a nice indoor pool and fitness center and access to computers in the business center too. Their prices are very reasonable for the level of service they provide. If you are looking for value and comfort, I suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel, good chain”
Reviews.Author: dler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Champaign on Easter eve to be by family. Had stayed at a Country Inn in Gettysburg last year, liked it. This was very similar. Everything you want in a moderate chain: clean, comfortable, good value, good breakfast. Not luxury, but some extra touches that have made it a terrific option for people that look for Hamptons, Holiday Inn Express, etc. Cookies at desk, books to borrow, coffee 24 hours a day, and above average friendliness from staff. I also like the real stairway from lobby to second floor--not dingy, end of the hall fire escapes that most chains use. Overall, a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Champaign”
Reviews.Author: aussieg3
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my two night visit to Champaign over Christmas because I did not want to board my dog for the holiday and I knew that Country Inn & Suites was: * a pet friendly chain * offered free breakfast * was a chain that had a great reputation I was very pleased with my decision. The hotel was clean (my room, the common areas, the indoor pool from what I could see), the bed was comfortable, the staff was pleasant and welcomed my four-legged family member, the breakfast was great - many choices, and the outside was well lit with ample grassy areas for walking my dog safely. I most definitely will stay here again my next time in town and will actively seek out other Country Inns in different places I visit. Great hotel (and great location in Champaign).

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: smoky1
Reviews.Content: a nice clean motel--clerk was very pleasant-room was very clean-pool area was nice-breakfast area was larger than most and nice--close to restaurants and walmart--will stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good lodging option if in C/U area”
Reviews.Author: islandexplorer
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Trip Advisor reviews and decided to try this one. Convenient location, near the interstate, but noise was not an issue. Appears to be a fairly new hotel. Registration was fast and friendly. Put us in a room on 3rd floor to avoid the noise from the pool, since they were filled with small soccer players all weekend. Rooms was very clean. We took a pass on the morning breakfast. The room was filled with all those soccer players and there are many good breakfast options in C/U (see Courier Cafe). All in all a typical chain hotel, with nothing negative to report. Would select it again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home in the Mid West”
Reviews.Author: Pam_Shapiro_2004
Reviews.Content: We are staying here at the moment for 3 weeks following the birth of my first grandchild, here in Champaign, Illinois. My son and daughter in law came to check out this hotel before I booked it, but they didn't really do it justice as to how nice and friendly and how clean and welcoming this hotel is!! The staff could not do enough for us. The rates (for extended stay) are very reasonable, and they include a very comprehensive breakfast, over and above the usual "quick continental type". There is also a small indoor pool, and a small gym. Rooms are serviced every day, lots of clean towels. The Housekeeping is excellent and the whole place is very clean. We are delighted with a random choice, really. We have been here for one week and have another 2 weeks to go. I would recommend this hotel for anyone passing through this part of the USA, or for a longer stay on business, etc. Also, although it is quite a large property, on the whole it is very quiet. Also, very well run by the Management. At the moment, I cannot praise it highly enough!! Trip Advisor Member, Cheshire, England ps: my granddaughter was born safely on 28th Sept 07!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjkitto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It was clean, and the king size bed gave a wonderful night's sleep. We had a private spa bath in the room which was a delight. Great service. The only downside was when our air conditioner wasn't working properly, they fixed it promptly but said they would give us a discount for the inconvenience. We were completely satisfed with this, but then when I went to check out the clerk told me it was not possible to give me a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want your expectations exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: fballwidow
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this 3-day, 2-night stay. Our room was very clean (non-smoking room w/ two queen beds.) We were supplied with iron and board, hair dryer, desk with office chair, and a comfy club chair. We called to say we were coming in earlier than check-in time. The staff person was more than accomodating, and said our room would be ready shortly after the lunch hour. Upon our request, they had furnished us with a refrigerator and microwave oven. These items were not provided in this room, but they had them ready and waiting for us! What service! The fridge was already cold when we got to the room. Our room was on the first floor, and directly across from the pool area. The pool room was bright and clean, very well supplied with towels, and the spa was emptied and cleaned daily. There was a fitness room with 3 machines, but the treadmill was out of order. We were given access to the business center with a separate swipe key, and were able to access the internet and check our e-mail daily. We also appreciated the free USA Today and daily local newspaper: The News-Gazette. The hotel was booked every night, but it didn't seem too crowded. We stayed one weekday morning and one weekend morning. The breakfast choices were more than you see at continental breakfasts. There were omelets with ham and cheese - being kept hot with flames. There were do-it-yourself Belgian waffles - yum! Other items: bagels, English muffins, several danish options, hot and cold cereals, fresh fruit, fruit cups . . . coffee, juice and milk. All served in a cozy breakfast room off the lobby. Wow! Upon check-out, we failed to get our receipt to turn in for business purposes. We called to ask them to mail the receipt to our home address and the always-helpful staff agreed. Once we arrived back home, we received a phone call from the person who took our request. They explained that because we booked through Expedia, they would not be able to follow through with our request, as the rates we contracted through Expedia would not match their rates. It was not suprising to know that the staff went the extra mile ~ again ~ to contact us to say that we would not be getting the receipt and did not want us to be looking for something in the mail that would not be coming. We would definately stay here again, and would highly recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Champaign”
Reviews.Author: AHS06
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the CI & S this month and loved it. The minute I checked in, the front desk clerk called me about a fax I received and brought it right up. The room was clean, smelled fresh, and had a long hallway because I had a lot of gear. It was perfect because they also put me next to the elevator. I used the pool and Jacuzzi too and both were clean and hardly used. The breakfast was excellent with a lot of choices and friendly staff. I asked them about restaurants in the area and was pleasantly directed to a variety of them with good directions. i would definitely stay there again.Wat a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Service Oriented, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chayadina
Reviews.Content: Since I began visiting the area for work in July 2006, I stay at the Country Inn and Suites regularly (as well as when we are out of town in Indiana and Wisconsin). This location in particular is especially consistant with its service and accomodations. Breakfast offers a wide variety of items, heatlhy and indulgent. Rooms are clean, comfortable, large. When my husband comes with me we usually get a suite which is super-large and has a refrigerator and microwave, at a very reasonable rate. There is a nice, clean work out room, pool and office room with two Internet connected computers. Best of all a free shuttle is available most days to take you to campus or the airport if reserved.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Inn & Suites Champaign-North
HotelInfo.Address: 602 West Martketview Dr., Champaign, IL 61822
